## Introduction

Systematic file management is essential for Digital Humanities research, especially for projects involving multiple sources, collaborators, or long-term data collection.

::: {.callout-important}
## For Doctoral Researchers

With projects spanning 3-5 years, involving multiple institutions, and generating diverse data types, consistent file naming and backup strategies prevent data loss and enable collaboration.
:::

---

## File Naming Conventions

### Core Principles

::: {.callout-tip}
## Quick Reference: File Naming Rules

1. **Use dates:** `YYYY-MM-DD` format (ISO 8601) - universal across countries
2. **No spaces:** Use hyphens `-` or underscores `_`
3. **Be descriptive:** Include project, source, version
4. **Version numbers:** v01, v02, v03 (not "final")
5. **No special characters:** Avoid é, à, ç, ñ, /, \, ?, *
6. **Language-neutral:** Use English or transliterated names for international collaboration

**Example for archival photos:**  
`2025-06-15_paris-natlib_ms-fr-12345_fol-23r_v01.jpg`  
(Date_Archive_Manuscript_Folio_Version)
:::

## Naming Conventions for Specific DH Data Types

### Transcriptions

```txt
[date]_[source-archive]_[document-id]_transcription_[version].txt

Example:
2025-06-20_bnf_ms-lat-8501_fol-12v_transcription_v03.txt
```

### Digitized Images

```txt
[date]_[archive]_[collection]_[item-id]_[folio/page]_[version].jpg

Example:
2025-03-15_vat-lib_pal-lat_1071_fol-45r_v01.tif
```

### Interview Recordings

```txt
[date]_interview_[participant-id]_[location]_[recorder].mp3

Example:
2025-09-10_interview_p05_rome_audio-01.mp3
```

### 3D Models

```txt
[date]_[site]_[object-type]_[scan-method]_[processing-stage].obj

Example:
2025-07-22_pompeii_fresco_photogrammetry_raw.obj
2025-07-22_pompeii_fresco_photogrammetry_cleaned.obj
```

### Metadata Files

```txt
[date]_[project]_[data-type]_metadata_[version].csv

Example:
2025-11-05_choral-manuscripts_images_metadata_v02.csv
```

```txt
choral-phd-project/
├── 00-admin/
│   ├── dmp/                     # Data Management Plans
│   ├── ethics/                  # Ethics documentation
│   └── funding/                 # Grant documents
├── 01-primary-sources/
│   ├── archives/
│   │   ├── raw-images/         # Original photos from archives
│   │   ├── processed/          # Cropped, enhanced versions
│   │   └── metadata/           # Spreadsheets with source info
│   ├── transcriptions/
│   │   ├── draft/
│   │   └── final/
│   └── fieldnotes/
├── 02-secondary-sources/
│   ├── literature/
│   └── bibliography/           # Zotero exports, etc.
├── 03-datasets/
│   ├── raw/                    # Never modify!
│   ├── cleaned/                # OpenRefine outputs
│   └── analysis-ready/
├── 04-analysis/
│   ├── scripts/                # R, Python, etc.
│   ├── outputs/
│   └── visualizations/
├── 05-publications/
│   ├── article-01/
│   ├── dissertation/
│   └── conference-posters/
├── 06-public-engagement/
│   ├── exhibition-materials/
│   └── teaching-resources/
├── documentation/
│   ├── README.md              # Project overview
│   ├── codebook.md            # Variable definitions
│   ├── changelog.md           # Project history
│   └── file-naming-guide.md   # Your conventions
└── archive/                    # Deprecated versions
```

## Backup Strategies: The 3-2-1 Rule

### Understanding 3-2-1 for Research Projects

::: {.callout-tip}
## The 3-2-1 Backup Rule

- **3** copies of your data
  - Original working copy
  - Backup at institution
  - Backup at home OR cloud
  
- **2** different media types
  - Local hard drive (laptop/desktop)
  - External hard drive OR university server
  - Cloud storage (Nextcloud, Huma-Num)
  
- **1** copy off-site
  - Geographically separate
  - Protected from local disasters (fire, theft)
  - Accessible when traveling or working remotely
:::

### Practical Implementation

**Challenge:** Managing data across multiple work locations

**Solution:**

1. **Primary working storage:** University Nextcloud/cloud (syncs everywhere)
2. **Local backup:** External hard drive at office or home
3. **Off-site backup:** Institutional server or Huma-Num

**Best practices:**

- Keep active projects on cloud storage for easy access
- Carry external drive for large files (videos, high-res images)
- Test restoration periodically to verify backups work

## File Formats for Digital Humanities

### Preservation-Friendly Formats by Data Type

::: {.callout-note}
## Prioritize open, documented formats

Proprietary formats risk obsolescence. Choose formats with:

- Open specifications
- Wide tool support
- No licensing restrictions
- Good for long-term preservation
:::

| Data Type | Preferred Formats | Avoid | Notes |
|-----------|-------------------|-------|-------|
| **Plain text** | .txt, .md | .pages, .doc | UTF-8 encoding! |
| **Structured text** | .xml (TEI), .json | Proprietary XML | TEI for scholarly editions |
| **Tabular data** | .csv, .tsv | .xlsx, .numbers | Use semicolons for European locales |
| **Images (photos)** | .tiff (archival), .jpg (access) | .psd, proprietary RAW | Keep RAW separately |
| **Images (diagrams)** | .svg, .png | .ai, .sketch | SVG is scalable |
| **3D models** | .obj, .ply, .gltf | .max, .blend | Include textures separately |
| **Audio** | .wav, .flac | .mp3 (lossy) | Lossless for primary sources |
| **Video** | .mp4 (H.264), .mkv | .mov, proprietary codecs | Document settings |
| **Databases** | .sql, .csv exports | .mdb, .accdb | Export to open formats |
| **Manuscripts** | .pdf/A, TEI .xml | .docx, .indd | PDF/A for archival |

### TEI (Text Encoding Initiative)

**The DH standard for encoding texts**

- **Website:** <https://tei-c.org/>
- **Why use TEI:**
  - Scholarly standard for digital editions
  - Captures textual structure and features
  - Interoperable across projects
  - Long-term preservation

**Learning resources:**

- [TEI by Example](https://teibyexample.org/)
- [Women Writers Project Guide](https://wwp.northeastern.edu/outreach/seminars/)
- [TEI Course at DARIAH](https://teach.dariah.eu/course/view.php?id=32)

## Data Management Plans (DMP)

### Why DMPs Matter

**Required by:**

- European Commission (Horizon Europe)
- National funders (ANR, ERC)
- Many doctoral schools

**A DMP specifies:**

- What data you'll collect/create
- How it will be stored and backed up
- Who can access it
- How it will be preserved after your PhD
- Costs and responsibilities

### DMP Tools

#### 1. DMP OPIDoR (Recommended for French institutions)

- **URL:** <https://dmp.opidor.fr/>
- **Features:**
  - French and English interface
  - Templates for ANR, H2020, ERC
  - Integration with institutional systems
  - Support for collaborative projects

**Tutorial:** [DoRANum DMP Guide](https://doranum.fr/tag/plan-de-gestion-des-donnees/) (French with some English)

#### 2. DMPonline (UK-based, international)

- **URL:** <https://dmponline.dcc.ac.uk/>
- **Features:**
  - Funder-specific templates
  - Guidance for each question
  - Institutional branding

#### 3. ARGOS (European)

- **URL:** <https://argos.openaire.eu/>
- **Features:**
  - Part of OpenAIRE infrastructure
  - Supports collaborative editing
  - Machine-actionable DMPs

### DMP Resources

- **[DARIAH DMP Guidelines](https://www.dariah.eu/)** - Arts & humanities focus
- **[DCC DMP Checklist](https://www.dcc.ac.uk/resources/data-management-plans)** - Comprehensive
- **[Science Europe DMP Evaluation Rubric](https://www.scienceeurope.org/our-priorities/research-data/research-data-management/)** - What funders look for

## Metadata Best Practices for Cultural Heritage

### Why Metadata Matters

**Without metadata, your data is useless:**

- Where was this photo taken?
- Who created this document?
- What do these column headers mean?
- Can I reuse this 3D model?

### Metadata Standards for DH

| Domain | Standard | Link |
|--------|----------|------|
| **Cultural Objects** | CIDOC-CRM | <http://www.cidoc-crm.org/> |
| **Libraries** | Dublin Core, MARC | <https://www.dublincore.org/> |
| **Archives** | EAD, ISAD(G) | <https://www.loc.gov/ead/> |
| **Museums** | LIDO, SPECTRUM | <http://lido-schema.org/> |
| **Manuscripts** | TEI msDesc | <https://tei-c.org/release/doc/tei-p5-doc/en/html/MS.html> |
| **Images** | IIIF | <https://iiif.io/> |
| **Geographic** | GeoJSON, KML | <https://geojson.org/> |

### Minimal Metadata for Any File

**Always include:**

- **Creator/Author:** Who made this?
- **Date:** When (YYYY-MM-DD)?
- **Description:** What is it?
- **Source:** Where did it come from?
- **License/Rights:** Can others use it?

**For images, also include:**

- Archive/institution
- Collection name
- Shelfmark/identifier
- Physical description

## Checklists & Templates

### File Organization Checklist

::: {.callout-tip}
## Before Starting Your PhD

- [ ] Define file naming convention (document it!)
- [ ] Create directory structure
- [ ] Set up cloud sync (Nextcloud/Huma-Num)
- [ ] Configure external hard drive backup
- [ ] Write initial README file
- [ ] Draft Data Management Plan (if required)

## During Your PhD

- [ ] Name files consistently (review quarterly)
- [ ] Backup data weekly (automate!)
- [ ] Update README with changes
- [ ] Version important files clearly
- [ ] Document data collection methods

## Before Graduation

- [ ] Clean up directory structure
- [ ] Remove duplicates
- [ ] Finalize all documentation
- [ ] Deposit data in repository (Zenodo/Nakala)
- [ ] Update DMP with final information
:::

### README Template for Research Projects

```markdown
# Project Title

## Project Information
- **PI:** Your Name
- **Institution:** UPPA / ED 481 SSH
- **Start date:** YYYY-MM-DD
- **End date:** YYYY-MM-DD
- **Funding:** [If applicable]

## Project Description
[2-3 paragraph description of research]

## Directory Structure
- `/01-primary-sources` - Source materials
- `/02-secondary-sources` - Literature
- `/03-datasets` - Structured data
- [etc.]

## File Naming Convention
[Explain your system]

Example: `YYYY-MM-DD_source_description_version.ext`

## Data Collection
- **Archives visited:** [list]
- **Dates:** [list]
- **Equipment used:** [camera, scanner, etc.]

## Software & Tools
- Transcription: [tool]
- Analysis: [tool]
- Visualization: [tool]

## Data Formats
- Images: TIFF (archival), JPEG (access copies)
- Text: TEI XML for editions, TXT for notes
- Tabular: CSV with UTF-8 encoding

## Backup Strategy
- Primary: UPPA Nextcloud
- Secondary: External HD (weekly)
- Tertiary: Huma-Num (monthly)

## Rights & Licensing
- **Data license:** [CC-BY, CC0, etc.]
- **Code license:** [if applicable]
- **Restrictions:** [e.g., embargo until publication]

## Contact
- **Email:** your.email@univ-pau.fr
- **ORCID:** 0000-0000-0000-0000

## Changelog
- 2025-09-15: Initial setup
- 2026-01-10: Added transcriptions folder
- [etc.]
```
